item.title: The Best Page In The Universe
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

slayer215:

And then I remembered how funny his newest page was…

Lol. Out of all the times I said lol to something, I believe this may have been the first time I actually laughed out loud. It’s too bad he doesn’t update regularly anymore.

Btw, you can have an image inside a quote:

Possibly the first and only cliche in history I've wanted to bang, curly-haired black women are the preferred marketing tool to sell obscure telecom products and telephone services so long as their skin tone isn't too dark. She should be dark enough to score that hip diversity dollar, but not so dark as to scare away that heartland racist dollar.

Microsoft also tried to employ use of the hot black woman for marketing Vista recently, but as usual, they got it wrong

Fuck it.

Read full topic
item.source: The Best Page In The Universe

item.title: The Best Page In The Universe
item.dc:creator: @slayer215 slayer215
item.description:
@slayer215 wrote:

Maddox is great. I thought his page on real men was probably the funniest.
http://www.thebestpageintheuniverse.net/c.cgi?u=real_men

And then I remembered how funny his newest page was…

Possibly the first and only cliche in history I've wanted to bang, curly-haired black women are the preferred marketing tool to sell obscure telecom products and telephone services so long as their skin tone isn't too dark. She should be dark enough to score that hip diversity dollar, but not so dark as to scare away that heartland racist dollar.

Microsoft also tried to employ use of the hot black woman for marketing Vista recently, but as usual, they got it wrong:


Fuck it.
- Microsoft's advertising agency

item.title: The Best Page In The Universe
item.dc:creator: @lordslayer565 lordslayer565
item.description:
@lordslayer565 wrote:

Rofl! I read 1 letter and already like it

Date: Wed, 7 Jul 2004 03:21:52 EDT
From: “Ty Shane” ##########@aol.com
To: maddox@xmission.com
Subject: congrats asshole

Mailer:i read the phrases that piss you off and it sounds alot like a george
carlin routine that i heard about a week ago. i’m a fan of you’r site
but get your on material next time.

Maker of site:Hey, thanks for the advice Ty. You see, after writing 300 or so pages of original material, every now and then I like to steal a few bits from someone famous like George Carlin just to see if I can sneak it in under the radar despite the fact that it would be impossible to get away with since millions of people have seen his performance.

What I didn’t count on was that an astute reader such as yourself would read my article and find a vague likeness to Carlin’s stand-up routine.

With skills like that, why are you writing barely intelligible letters to strangers when you could be doing detective work instead? You could go around to popular websites and find obvious similarities between satirical writers and famous entertainers.

I can see it now: “Detective Dipshit: Private Dick for hire.” Keep up the great work, dumbass.

Read full topic
